bnf_parser

Class BnfParser.Subparser

  • java.lang.Object
    • bnf_parser.BnfParser.Subparser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SubparserInterface
    Enclosing class:
    BnfParser

    protected class BnfParser.Subparser
extends java.lang.Object
implements SubparserInterface
    Inner class which is the brain of the parser. All the magic happens here.
    Author:
    Hubert Lemelin

      • fileSize

        Stores the filesize of current opened file.

      • fileCharset

      • fileInputStream

        protected java.io.FileInputStream fileInputStream
        The instance of FileInputStream used to read the file.

      • charBuffer

        protected java.nio.CharBuffer charBuffer
        The instance of CharBuffer used to read the file. This allows to get substrings in the file without having to move the cursor explicitly.

      • charBufferPosition

        protected int charBufferPosition
        Current character position in the file. A character may have more than one byte.

      • rawBufferPosition

        protected int rawBufferPosition
        Current byte position in the file.

                 java.lang.String charset)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Opens the specified file.
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename of the file to open.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown whenever a file error occurs.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the current file.

      • evaluateRule

        public Collector evaluateRule(Rule rule)
                       throws ParsingFailedException,
                              CallableContainsMoreThanOneCollectorException,
                              NoFileSpecifiedException
        Description copied from interface: SubparserInterface
        Tries to match the specified rule.
        Specified by:
        evaluateRule in interface SubparserInterface
        Parameters:
        rule - The rule to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        Return an instance of the collector specified in the rule. It can be null so one must always check if it is null before calling any methods on it.
        Throws:
        ParsingFailedException - Thrown when the rule did not match.
        CallableContainsMoreThanOneCollectorException - Thrown when a callable contains more than one collector.
        NoFileSpecifiedException - Thrown when the parsing happens before any file was specified.

      • matchPattern

        public java.lang.String matchPattern(java.lang.String pattern)
        Checks if at the current parser's position the provided pattern matches.
        Specified by:
        matchPattern in interface SubparserInterface
        Parameters:
        pattern - the pattern to check which must not start with '^'
        Returns:
        the matched string if success, null otherwise

      • incrementRawBufferPosition

        protected void incrementRawBufferPosition(java.lang.String string)
        Increments the raw buffer position according to the string length computed using the used charset.
        Parameters:
        string - The string form which calculate the length.

      • length

        protected int length(java.lang.CharSequence sequence)
        Returns the total number of bytes in a SubSequebce. Many encodings such as UTF-8 sometimes use more than one byte to create a character. This method is used to calculate offset in the file.
        Parameters:
        sequence - The CharSequence from which return the length.
        Returns:
        The length of the sequence.
